title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was easy and recruiter was nice. She used the star method and answer all of my questions about in boarding and benefits. It took a few days to receive offer letter.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you made change in you company.

title: Accounts Payable Temp Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for this role was super easy. I was asked 3-5 questions about my previous work experience. After completing interview I heard back pretty fast in regards to being offered the position.
Interview Questions: Describe previous work experience as it pertains to accounts payable.

title: Audio Visual Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, scheduled a virtual call with one on one with the Associate Director (AD). After the virtual call, scheduled an onsite half day visit. 1-1 with AD over coffee. 1 Hour Session with the team (about 5 members) 1-1 with AV Tech and an audio setup 1-1 with Director of Student Center/Campus Life Tour of Student Events Area and some conference/meeting rooms
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself. Why Emory University? What do you think would be the most difficult thing about transitioning into the role? How do you handle finding a way to resolve conflict?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews. The first one centered around getting to understand your skills and motivation, and the second one trying to determine fit. A good experience overall, and pretty smooth response times too
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join the lab?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: straight forward, describe data experience, tell us about yourself, why are you a good fit for this position and what're some things you hope to gain from this role, what is your ideal work setting like
Interview Questions: describe your weaknesses and strengths

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was good. The interviewers asked if I had previous experience, had good organizational skills, and more. The interview lasted about one hour, and I had two additional follow-ups.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your organizational skills.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process! Quick response time and very transparent about their needs and my ability to serve them. Being able to speak with the 2 members from the research team, including a PI and the project coordinator was informative.
Interview Questions: What is my experience with data management and participant interviews?

title: Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and Zoom interview, interviewers were bossy and rude. Interview was also late. Not the best experience, would not interview here again. Lecture heavy interview. Phone interview and Zoom interview, interviewers were bossy and rude. Interview was also late. Not the best experience, would not interview here again. Lecture heavy interview.
Interview Questions: "Describe your perfect evaluation." "Where do you see yourself in 5 years?"

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, polite and to the point. Asked about relevant experience and previous positions. Wanted to hear about interests in research topics and potential projects in the position. Asked about what skills you bring to the team/to the position.
Interview Questions: What research projects would you be interested in initiating/participating in during your time here?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: I had a wonderful interview with the PI, and then I had met with the lab members to see if I was a good fit for the lab. The PI was passionate about the research her lab conducts related to pediatric sickle cell mechanisms.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: How well did you do in the class and your relationship with the professor must be both strong and make sense for you to be a teachers assistant. If not it will be very hard to get the role but otherwise should be strait forward a meeting with the teacher and maybe a few behavioral questions
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a TA

title: Public Health Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straight forth. I had two interviews where they asked standard questions about my resume, how I work with others, etc. I was offered a position on the team and accepted it tentatively based on HR's final decision. But was not given a salary and was told this would be decided by HR. HR requested 5 references and would want to hear from all of them. The team that was hiring me would also like to hear from 3 references/ a letter of recommendation. This all feels like a bit much for an entry to mid level position without at least a salary range given. Over a month later I am still waiting on a final response from HR and the team.
Interview Questions: Q: Why would you be a good fit for the position?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: It is very challenging to get a foot in the door to get an interview at Emory. If they have an internal candidate selected, the interview process may drag on with few updates. Typically, you won’t find out you were not awarded the position until everything is finalized with the preferred candidate. Their application system can make it hard to apply to multiple openings at the same time, but I am going to continue to apply to positions — it’s just a matter of finding the right match and the right person in charge of the job hunt.
Interview Questions: These are smart people, expect to face questions about basic program management processes, questions about how you dealt with a failure in a past job, and scenario questions. Q: Tell us about a time you went over budget.

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Way too competitive and there wasn’t a clear decision making process being shared. Did a lot of prep for the interview but there’s apparently so much competition. I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone doubting if they can stand out amongst 200 candidates.
Interview Questions: What makes Emory University unique

title: Teaching Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: The chair gave background information about the department and described the interview procedure. The interviewers introduced themselves. Each interviewer asked one question and finally opened the floor for the candidate to ask questions.
Interview Questions: 1. What is your research focus and how does it inform your teaching? 2. (asked and answered in Chinese): Give an example of grammatical point that is challenging to U.S. students and how do you teach it 3. Given the current challenge faced in Chinese programs, what's your solution? 4. What is the core knowledge students need to learn for understanding modern Chinese society? 5. The responsibility of teaching assistant professor is mainly in teaching and service, but faculty in Emory University also conduct classroom based research. Are you conducting this kind of research now or what research in this sort do you expect to do in the future?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: It was conducted smoothly. The interviewer is nice and he asks me to introduce myself and share something on my resume. He also shared some insights into his career at the school.
Interview Questions: The most inspiring past experience

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds, star questions, let you know the salary upfront. Went through your history and what projects you worked on. Pretty easy interview. Went by within 3 weeks they give an answer.
Interview Questions: What projects have you led and how did they end up?

title: Assistant Vice President Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Demanding interview process consisted of committee review and repetitive examination. Never was I so extensively screened for qualifications. The interviewer posits himself very endearingly. How many words does this whole description need, I just want info on AMD right now.
Interview Questions: What do you envision for Emory

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Great question equal opportunity. They talk to you as an equal and don’t look down on you. They explain everything in full and you get to your and do a mock run if you get to phase 2 of the interview.
Interview Questions: What is the order of draw.

title: Informatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute interview with manager and then an hour long with 4(!) staff members. Never heard back, completely ghosted. Gave 1.5+ of my time, a stock email rejection would be nice.
Interview Questions: Asked some questions on how I'd reform some basic SQL queries (SELECT, UNION, etc). Would be much better if they had a way to test that knowledge in a practical way.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard. The interview involved hiring manager + team. The process took a few weeks; month from start to finish. Experience definitely variable based on things like role, location, and department.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and / or weaknesses?

title: Associate Director of Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was a long and thorough process, lasting a couple months, but that's to be expected with academia. It began with an introductory call over Zoom with the hiring manager. Within a week, I had two 30-minute interviews with a panel of three employees each. After a few weeks, I had another Zoom call with the hiring manager to check-in. Then, another round of interviews with other employees. The hiring manager was transparent later in the process that I was a finalist, however I did not receive an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience in the field.

title: Sr. Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: A lot of situational questions. Just be prepared by practicing your answers. A lot of questions will be answered from your experience. The questions are not that difficult if you are prepared.
Interview Questions: What was the one thing you would do over in your last job to correct.

title: Project Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The process included 1 interview with the supervisor of the research project. I was asked basic interview questions and questions related to the role. I was asked to rate my skill level on certain skills from 1 to 10. Be prepared to discuss your work experience and skill levels.
Interview Questions: On a scale of 1 to 10, rate your skill level in the following areas?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: I had 5 interviews over the course of 2 weeks. It was friendly and open with little pressure. The interviewers (a total of 15 across all interviews) asked a mix of professional and outside-of-work questions including hobbies and goals.
Interview Questions: Is there any part of the requirements for the job posting that you will have difficulty meeting?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: they first let me introduce myself and asked several Behavior questions regarding my background experience. and then I was asked some technical questions about survival analysis that was related to the lab that I was applying.
Interview Questions: Describe one experience when you have trouble solving a challenge.

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Emory University in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for a student ambassador at the emory police department is primarily behavioral. They will ask questions like your interests, run me through your work experience, etc. They want to see if you fit the small team well.
Interview Questions: What could you contribute to the team?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward and fairly thoughtful. Lots of introspection required both before and after the process, which was neither too long nor too short considering the position was for a yearlong opportunity
Interview Questions: Describe your weaknesses in three words

title: Assistant Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions:
Submit my application through Emory Career and wait for the response. 
Round 1: Interview with supervisor (30 min talk)
Round 2: Meet department heads individually (3 hours in total) and give a public presentation (45 min plus Q&A)
Interview Questions:
Introduce yourself
Why do you want to work here
Why did you leave your previous job
Do you have any plan to improve yourself here

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview that took approximately thirty minutes. Single interviewer that asked approximately five different questions, and opened up to questions that I had.  The interview lasted approximately thirty minutes and was pretty simple.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a virtual interview with my direct lead about two weeks from applying for the position. The hour conversation was pleasant and natural. The second interview was later that week with a department colleague - also virtual and similar in nature in terms of dialogue feeling conversational and organic, while still holding space for roles and responsibilities. I was offered the role by phone two weeks following the last interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us your trajectory - what themes presented itself that led to you  applying for this role.

title: Testing Site Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Smooth process.  Interview was timely and questions were appropriate for the role. Feedback provided within 24 hours post interview to keep the process moving forward.   Ask questions to understand role completely.
Interview Questions: How do you value customer service?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Average, situation-based questions. Ask about terminology that's relevant to the position, will ask culture-fit questions as well as what you bring to the table. The company did not get back to me.
Interview Questions: Q: What makes you a good fit for the company?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen and panel behavioral interview.  Please do research on the organization and the role. Make sure you have prepared questions that align with the job duties. Make sure you also understand the department you are interviewing for.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in this role?

title: Senior Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process for me was 4 separate steps. 
1. Initial phone interview (approx 15-20 mins)
2. Secondary video interview (approx 45 mins)
3.  Panel Interview (45mins - 1 hr)
4. Interview with Executive Director (approx 30 mins)
After all interviews were completed, was also asked to complete a writing assignment - spent several hours over the course of a 3-4 days. 
Followed 2 weeks later and was informed they selected an internal candidate who they noted had a "considerable edge"
All the staff I interviewed with were very pleasant and generally responsive, but quite disappointed that they took me through the entire process when there was an internal candidate for which they knew had a large advantage over an external candidate. Ultimately, felt like it was a waste of my time and effort.
Interview Questions:
What is one of your weaknesses/strengths?
Why are you interested in this position?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview to get to know you. Asked about previous job/ clinical experiences. Was informed about salary, expectations of each clinic, and caseload. Shadowing at different clinics was part of the process to get to know the different clinics in Atlanta.
Interview Questions: What type of patients did you see during your past jobs/clinicals?

title: Student Stacks Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Long, but straightforward.  Got a long description of the duties of stacks work. You pretty much just need to listen and agree to the job. You don't have much to worry about.
Interview Questions: If you're willing to work the job.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: I applied through their system online, and set up an interview 2 weeks later. I completed the interview, and was given an assignment to complete. After completing that assignment I heard back within a month.
Interview Questions: How does this position line up with your career goals?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Once app was submitted it took a couple of weeks to receive a response.  Had phone screening and then did interview with hiring manager.   Background Check was conducted.  Start date given.  Training was provided where applicable.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Asked why do you want to be a TA? What was your favorite part about the class? How would you improve the class? What was your least favorite part of the class?
Interview Questions: Tell me a bit about yourself?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: This was for a temporary role so it may look different from a full-time position. I joined on a Zoom call after I sent in my application to the Emory University job portal.
Interview Questions:
They asked me what administrative experience I had. 

"Tell me about yourself." 

"What is your learning style?"

"Why do you want to work at Emory?"

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory University in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I had three separate, back-to-back interviews with biostatistics professors. They asked me about my previous research, why I want the Ph.D., and why I think I can finish the program when I haven't had a break from school in years.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do with the PhD?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied in February and received a phone call from the employer a month later. The first interview was a phone interview about my past experience related to this position. The second interview was a virtual interview with a program team-member / group meeting.
Interview Questions:
What is your weakness and strength?
How would you deal with conflict? 
Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Advancement - Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward. The panel seemed to be very engaged and had a willingness to learn more about my experience. There was a phone screen and then a panel interview with approximately six panelists.
Interview Questions: Why Emory University and what do you know about this organization?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: There is one round with the professor you will be working with. In my case it is a finance professor and mainly asking coding questions in SQL. There are 4-5 questions in total and they are all pretty basic. After that you need to express your interest in the job, like why research in this field as well as speaking on your background.
Interview Questions:
How would you query any 10 results from the database?

How do you join these 2 tables?

How do you count columns?

How do you find values similar to "ABC"? (use LIKE operator)

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was with the dean and two members of the team. They made the experience more of a conversation rather than round robin of questions and they were all so nice. They gave a clear outline of their timeline and instructions on the process. They were also quick to respond and offered thoughtful feedback. I didn't have as much experience as some other candidates so I wasn't offered the position but they did ask me to apply for another position on their team.
Interview Questions: What specific experience do you have assisting students with the pre-health application process?

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth. I had a phone screening, 1 to 1 interview and a panel interview (all virtual.) Due to pandemic the time the time from application to acceptance was about 10 weeks.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your day to day workload?

title: Chief Business Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Initial telephone interview with recruiter; asked about experience, career goals. Asked for real life examples of projects, responsibilities, and professional experience that related to role for which I was interviewing
Interview Questions: What previous experience related to the role.

title: Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by an Emory alumni, and she asked a variety of questions.  I was honored to be selected because not everyone gets an alumni interview.  This was actually my first interview and she asked a variety of questions.
Interview Questions: How would you improve the community?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to study here?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: ~the interview was approximately 6 hours ( including lunch) where I met with various faculty members. The purpose was to see whether I had overlapping research interests and to learn about opportunities for collaborations
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Intramural Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with the director of intramural and club sports. Majority of the questions involved current and past experiences, perceived skillsets, and how I would respond to various situations. Additional questions were about goals and expectations. Current employees were also present during the interview.
Interview Questions: What would others say is your greatest strength and weakness? What would you say is your greatest strength and weakness?

title: Lab Prep Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: No interview, personal connection. I enjoyed taking the BIOL class with my professor and asked her if I could get a job on campus. She then offered me the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Challenging but worth the time.  Interviewed with multiple people who seemed excited about their jobs.  Very friendly and motivated and determined to get the right fit.  Not rushing the process but taking time to find the right fit for the department.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions:
How did you find out about this position?
Why are you interested in working as a research assistant?
What are your long-term career goals?
Why do you want to work for this organization?
Describe a time you overcame a challenge at work.
What are your greatest strengths?
What skills are you working to improve?
Tell me about your hobbies.
How would previous colleagues or classmates describe you?
What do you find interesting about research assistance?
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Need to be very knowledgeable of the mission process. Must be experienced and must possess excellent people skills and be multiculturally aware. Speaking another language other than English is a plus and necessary skill.
Interview Questions: How may you assist a non-English speaking candidate to have access to our medical research team?

title: Post Doctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Friendly in general. It involved a presentation followed by technical questions.  Afterwards had the opportunity to meet with peers and students individually after lunch with the boss and senior researchers in the lab.
Interview Questions: Challenges faced and how you dealt with it?

title: MBA Applications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple. They ask behavioral questions and how would apply past learnings in the MBA. Another important one is how do you plan to contribute in class. Interviews lasts about 30 minutes
Interview Questions: How will you contribute to class learnings?

title: Medical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I applied via the online portal and heard back he next day. Had a phone screening, an interview with the hiring manager, then four panel interviews with 2-3 people, which lasted an hour. 

I was told the final step was going to be just a reference-checking. When that was completed, I was ghosted by the hiring manager; I emailed her twice and got no response. Very professional, right? 

The hiring portal still says that I'm, "under consideration". I'm not interested in working for such rude and unprofessional individuals. I'm attempting to delete my online profile, but even they aren't being cooperative about that!
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
What is your weakness?
What do you like to do for fun?
What is passive voice?
How many publications do you have?
Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Dinning Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: It was great and very easy to do. The people were nice who did the interview and very informative about job position. The managers were nice and overall I had a great interview experience.
Interview Questions: What makes me different from other applicants

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: It was firstly at conference meeting and half an hour interviewing with four future colleagues and then an onsite job talk. The job talk was a full day meetings with everyone in the department and several college leaders.
Interview Questions: What areas are you good and comfortable for teaching

title: Legal Department Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Zoom met with lots of supervisory staff and laterals, very friendly at first, then judge-y and political, you'd better be on the right side of politics or you don't stand a chance.
Interview Questions: Resume coverage and experience questions

title: HR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy.  The first was a phone conversation, and then an in-person interview.  A lot of references are requested. The references are also required to provide a lot of information.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background.

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions:
Quite casual as it was for an undergrad student position. 

After receiving a follow up email with an invitation to interview, I met with the Research Assistant of the lab who asked a couple of typical interview questions. She gave me a brief tour of the lab and the responsibilities of the position. Afterwards, we me briefly with the professor which was when I was formally offered the position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in research?

title: Nursing Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: I first applied online at Emory Careers. The interview was via Zoom call (because of current quarantine). The interview was by the Unit Director. I was asked how I work in fast paced environments, what was a time I experienced conflict at work & how I solved it, and why I want the position as the Unit Clerk.
Interview Questions: How do you work in fast paced environments?

title: Wellness Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Very involved. Highly engaging. Group interviews with many people. Very flexible to work with on zoom calls. Have lots of information on the company as a whole. Used basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Emory.

title: Student Digital Life Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, they ask basic interview questions. Preparation did not take too long. Make sure you can speak on your experiences on your resume and explain why you are a good fit for the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, why do you want this position, what does good customer service look like to you.

title: Screener/Greeter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed once over the phone, lasted 20-30 mins. Was pretty smooth, asked about work history and gave good description of job title. They were clear about it being a temporary contract job.
Interview Questions: How do you work with and handle upset visitors/patient?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Completed 3 virtual interviews which seemed very promising and was going to get a call back or email about 4th interview then the manager of the department went ghost! I emailed twice and nothing! That was a terrible thing exp. But I expected that from Emory
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and background

title: Accout Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was normal. I had a total of 3 interviews. Two of the interviews were panel. I enjoyed the interview process. Everyone I met was personable.  They asked several questions from behavioral to technical.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: I was called to ask questions about my interests in being a researcher and I was asked questions about my research in cosmology related to dark matter and Bose-Einstein condensate
Interview Questions: Tell us more of the most recent project that you have been working on

title: Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was sent a link to sign up for my desired specialty. The interview took place over Zoom. The interview consisted of many scenario-based questions, and the last ten minutes was time for me to ask the interviewer questions. The interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How did you prioritize patient care?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: I had two initial one on one interviews with two different individuals to start. Then they scheduled me for 7 more interviews with 20+ interviews over a two week span. The interviews were extremely early in the morning (before business hours), and I had no say so in the scheduling. The dates and times were sent to me in a list. The interviews were extremely awkward. I found the interviewers to be ill-informed about the job. A long time later, I’ve heard nothing else from HR or the hiring manager.  The whole experience soured me on the organization.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Quick, not a lot of questions asked. Very basic.  Phone interview.  A second phone interview followed.  Very general questions from both HR personnel.  The first one lasted about 15 minutes.  The second one lasted about 25 minutes.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was two phases. One was a phone screen and then the second was an in person interview. I’d advise for you to be prepared for you’re phone screen. They will call you randomly and ask you if you have time to talk about the position you most recently applied for. If you can’t remember or just aren’t on your toes when speaking with a hiring manager it could look bad. So if you see any number you do not recognize calling you after you have applied to Emory don’t answer. Let it go to voicemail and the manager will leave you a detailed message about why they called. Then you can go back and research the position in detail then call back. The in person interview was super lax. Emory is very lax in general. They are down to earth and treat you like family. The interview process is very chill. It is hard to decipher if you are a good fit by how chill they are. With this being sad stand out. Bring extra copies of your resume. Have a business notepad. Take notes, ask MANY questions. Show them you are super chill, but very professional. I think part of their process is too see what your standards are and since they are intentionally chill, and you follow the lead of being that way also it can come off unprofessional.
Interview Questions:
Q. Why did you pick this position 

Q. What are your strengths and weaknesses

Q. What is your five year plan?

Q. Tell us about yourself? 

Q. What can you bring to the table?

Q. Tell us about your experience and how it relates to this position.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Let me start by saying that this was one of the best interview processes I’ve ever experienced, and it was relatively quick for an academic institution. I applied for the position in early July. I was contacted for a phone interview in the first week of August. The next week I was called to schedule an in person interview. 

The on site interview took place in mid-August. After introducing myself to the administrative assistant, I was almost immediately greeted by the current program coordinator and then the process began. I had 3 back to back 1 on 1 Interviews. The process lasted about an hour and a half to two hours and was completely seamless and well planned. I interviewed with the current Program Coordinator for about 30 minutes, then the individual who would manage me for an additional 30 minutes, and finally the Director for about 45 minutes. This was much less overwhelming than a panel would’ve been. I thoroughly enjoyed speaking with each interviewer, and found myself wishing I could spend more time with them after it was over. This was not a basic interview, where experience and ability were the only thing taken into account. All of the interviewers were very interested in my education, skill set, personality, and ability to work with a team.

 I was informed that I was the top candidate at the end of the same week as my onsite interview. I received a verbal offer at the beginning of the next week, and then received a final written offer a few days later. Overall the entire process from application to start date lasted about 2 months. This was unusually fast because they needed someone to fill the position rather quickly, yet the experience couldn’t have been more positive. I was kept informed at every stage in the process.
Interview Questions: What do you think sets you apart from others who applied to this position?
