title: Financial Aid Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the Financial Aid Advisor position at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) May 2017. Then called for an Interview in mid-June 2017.

Their interview process is one of the best interviews that I have ever experienced. I was never and it was pouring down rain. It was a 2 hour interview process with 2 different committees. I felt that they were impressed with me and made sure to explain how I truly know Financial Aid. I was myself and made sure to look at each person on the committee. You never know who is the deciding factor for the position.
Interview Questions: If you had a weekend to yourself (no family, kids, obligations), what would you do?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Evaded several questions regarding internal culture. I got the sense they didn't want to speak to who happened to the folks who had left prior. Couldn't explain the high turnover.
Interview Questions: Q: How would you handle a situation involving faculty and parents?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I took a very long time to hear anything, I waited months and emailed to get updates but the process was still stressful. The background check took the longest and there was no negotiation of salary on my level.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Simple and friendly, asked career goals and personal experience. The employer spent a lot of time explaining the job responsibilities and the organization. At the every end, they offered the job.
Interview Questions: How do you manage time?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through Emory's website. After my application was under review, it took a week to have a phone interview, and the next week was my in person interview. The interview process began with a phone interview and then an in person interview.  I was notified about the decision two weeks after my in person interview.
Interview Questions: What skills can you bring to the clinical research team?

title: Assistant Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Emory University in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with leaders a few times. That was the extent of the interviews. The interview processes for this job was not difficult but it does take a while to hear back.
Interview Questions: I don't have any specifics for interview questions.

title: Research Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the job in January.  I was emailed to do a phone interview in late February. Completed a team interview and 2 one-on-one interviews and one team bonding/meeting. I received the job offer in mid March.
Interview Questions: Explain a challenge you had to overcome.

title: Clinical Research Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1 - 3 hour interview with 6 different people. Applied online, 1.5 weeks later had an informal phone interview to determine if an in person interview was needed. Had an in person interview two weeks later, and less than a week after interview was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions were asked

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. One was with the marketing director and the next with the marketing team the following week. Process was average. They wanted to get a feel for my personality and skill set.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed to set up a telephone interview. There was a committee of people on the phone call. It would have been helpful to know who was on the committee prior to the call. Then the finalists had a campus interview.
Interview Questions: Questions were all related to content in the job description.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for a temporary position with 4 people. Applied for a different position and wasn't selected but resume forwarded to another recruiter and I received the position after interviewing. Had to go through process with HireRight.
Interview Questions: tell about a time you had to handle a difficult situation.

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took maybe 2 months with applying and getting a call back for an interview. There was 3 interview steps; 1st interview was a phone screen call in which was very pleasant and the recruiter asks a few customer service questions. Second interview was face to face in which did not last long about 15-20 minutes in which you sit with a recruiter and they just get a feel if you are a good fit for the position. Third interview is a group interview  in which they ask a few questions and each person has a chance to answer and you can ask questions to the interviewer as well. I felt like all the stages of the interview went well. After 3rd interview I waited about two weeks in which I emailed the HR lady and then I found out that I did not get the job. But it was a good experience and I would apply again for another position.
Interview Questions: Why Emory?

title: Public Health Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had an informational interview with someone from the project I wanted to work for within the Rollins School of Public Health at Emory. That informational interview led them to forward my résumé onto some project managers they thought would be interested in my experience and skills set. I received an email 2-3 weeks after the informational interview (from the project managers) requesting an interview. We scheduled it for the following week and we met in a conference room. The interview lasted exactly 45 minutes. Afterward, they said they would be conducting interviews all that week and would get back to who they chose by the end of the following week. The end of the following week came and went, and I heard nothing. However, that following Monday, I received a very nice email from the managers indicating that while I had not received the offer, they were still very interested in my experience and skills set and they asked if it would be okay if they passed my résumé onto some managers for upcoming positions. Overall, I'd call it a win.
Interview Questions: What was one time you had to work with a difficult client and how did you handle it?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I received an email several weeks after I applied. They asked questions via email and then scheduled an in person interview. I spoke with several members of the team and the associate director. They asked about my background and qualifications.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Academic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions:
Email from administrator, brief phone conversation the same day, final interview two days later. 

Process was quick and got the rejection a few days after the interview. 

Confused since my current position is exactly the same but who knows, most likely internal or alumni. One of the interviewers said "I think I got you figured out" which was very strange. Might inquire with HR.
Interview Questions: How will you adapt to this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
A long and drawn out process: I moved up in the resume pile by knowing a current employee. I had a phone interview and a few weeks later, an in person interview with my potential boss and a couple other department heads. The interview was very conversational - nothing too stressful. I was given a timeline for a response which they did not at all stick to. I was told, however, that I would be contacted when they reached a decision. After waiting a few weeks and not having heard a peep from them, I emailed one of my interviewers about their decision. No response. I waited a few more weeks and just couldn't take it anymore, so I called and discovered that I didn't get the job. 

I'm an empty alumni with a really good GPA and references and met the qualifications for the job, and the alumni association still rejected me. I wish I knew where I went wrong. 

The most disappointing part, however, is their lack of concern for candidates who are trying to work around a timeline that they don't even try to stick to. I wonder if they ever would have contacted me to let me know I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with technology and databases?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: After an initial Skype interview, I was invited to come give a seminar within the department. Following the seminar, I met with several faculty members as well as all the members of the lab. It was a long day, but I felt very welcome.
Interview Questions: Nothing specific. We just talked science most of the day

title: Patient Account Representative I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very formal.  Two people were in the room.  One person explained the position, then the other person asked 4 behavioral type questions.  I sensed the job was already taken when I entered the room and they were just going through the motions.  It wasn't very engaging, they were more concerned with writing down my answers to the questions then they were with actually getting to know me, as there wasn't much eye contact, which they apologized for in advance.  It was the quickest interview I've ever been on.  I tried to tell a little more about me but they wanted you to stick to the questions, I even asked at the end if they had any other questions for me and they flatly said no.  Basically they just wanted to know if you fit in with the staff.  I knew I didn't get the job when I left because I didn't even get to meet the staff or take a tour, I was just escorted out.  I really prepared for the interview and never got to show my true self.  They never even asked so tell me about yourself, although I did try to work that in their to be engaging, but they really don't want to hear anything other than what is asked. I am not sure behavioral type questions work best.  I felt like a robot just answer the questions and we will make a decision.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when .....(reference to a job)
I think it was something like, state the project, what steps were taken, what was the outcome, was it successful?

title: Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There are two rounds, the first is Phone interview, and the second is on-site Interview. If you have enough security and network fundamental knowledge, you are fine. I did well during the Interview. And I had a good discussion with the Technical hiring manager and the team. And after the on-site interview, they asked for 5 references from my professional manager and friends. But after I finished everything, they did not give me the offer, because they do not want to provide sponsorship. The HR told me that they wanted to open the job for several weeks to see if there is proficient US-citizen candidates.
Interview Questions: attacks and countermeasures in different layers

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: You will be invited to a campus visit if they think you are qualified. On-site interview will be held at that time. The faculties are very nice and you will be invited to some nice places in Atlanta.
Interview Questions: The questions will based on your research area and interest. For example something about your previous project.

title: Applications Developer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got mail from the recruiter.Scheduled the interview.Explained about her work and work to done by us once we got selected and about project.Interview is about 30 minutes and very friendly.She asked me to have brief introduction about me.Got offer after 3 days in mail about my compensation and benefits.
Interview Questions:
1.Tell me about yourself.
2.Difference between vector and arraylist?
3.Which methods are implemented in hash map?
4.how we handle exception in DB2 and java?
5.Difference between string,string buffer and string bulider?
6.difference between interface and abstract class?

title: Senior Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Details about professional and personal experience were asked. The best part was they asked about the programming language in which I'm most comfortable in and also the mistakes I did in my past professional experience.
Interview Questions: What are the bioinformatics pipelines you worked on?

title: IT Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, interview presentation, then meet & greet interview including box lunch with the stakeholders you work with.  Very intense process with regards to the 1 hour long presentation you must complete in the 2nd round.
Interview Questions: Describe your the best project you ever worked?

title: Senior Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through online job portal. Received a call later on to schedule the interview. The interview process was quite easy. Just a round of phone interview with typical technical questions. The complete process took 2 weeks from interview to get an offer.
Interview Questions: More of technical related to data structures  like hashmap, List etc

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: They ask about any previous research experience you may have had and your current research interests. They were also curious about your ability to think critically. There were multiple interviewers (4) all with varied backgrounds. Mostly they will talk about their research but I found it valuable to have read their papers and be prepared with a few questions for each.
Interview Questions: What type of research have you done?

title: Psotdoc Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I did not experience any interview, just feel the project is acceptable and come. No special feeling, just for finishing this project asap and get good publication. Then go back to China. 
By the way, it looks that the vacancy is quite easy to take.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: A lot easier. Students may get a part time job through networking with professors. A lot easier. Students may get a part time job through networking with professors. A lot easier. Students may get a part time job through networking with professors.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back...interviewer appeared to have Googled "Interview Questions".  No thought was put into the questions asked.  They are just trying to fill positions.  From speaking to other employees it is a revolving door in the clinical trials office.  Management not in tune with employee needs and the demands of the job are not aligned with the low compensation
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was on phone. I was interviewed by a technical person. She was very nice. Repeated the question when I didn't understand. I was asked an easy question about how to merge two sorted arrays
Interview Questions: Merge two sorted arrays

title: At Rollins School of Public Health Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Very cordial, friendly and relatively informal interview. The interview was in a glass room so people could see into the room and I could see out. Interviewer used my resume to refer to previous experiences and ask about relevant skills. Interview lasted approximately 30 minutes and I heard back within the week about the position.
Interview Questions: Relevant analytical skills, how would someone else describe me

title: IT Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: step 1:  phone screen by HR.  step 2:  phone interview with hiring manager.  step 3: in-person interview with hiring manager and some team members.  step 4: follow up phone conversation to address questions from both sides
Interview Questions: why are you a good fit for the position

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume on the Emory career website (EagleOps) and received email back three days later to request an interview later in the week. I interviewed in the office on Thursday with the associate director, who would become my future supervisor. I heard back from on Tuesday. It was a very expedient process and everyone at every step was cordial and professional.
Interview Questions: What kind of project would you initiate in this role and how would you go about initiating it?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: The interview panelist were warm,rigorous  and engaging. Went through 3 different interview panels. It was for not sure 3-4 days plus arrival and departure days process, we were lodged in a hotel, our feeding was taken care of. We had a tour of the city and a wonderful dinner with current students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to undergo a PhD? What are your areas of interest, what are your career goals, where do you see yourself  in 10 years time? Tell us about yourself?

title: Management Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process involved a phone interview, a group/panel interview and an interview with an executive level panel. The questions are standard and seek to identify your experience and fit with the team and organization.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience.

title: Academic Department Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via the Emory University website, the HR automated website sent me updates as I was moved through the process. Once the hiring manager decided to interview me, I received and email letting me know of their interest and scheduling the interview. What was especially helpful is that he sent me bullet points of what he would like to discuss so I was able to make notes and be very prepared and have a very productive conversation.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to this position?

title: Senior Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward experience. I completed a short telephone interview with 2 associates, and then an in-person panel interview with the same associates, a field interviewer, the PI and a co-investigator. Overall experience was pleasant and straightforward.
Interview Questions: If you had to tell us one thing about yourself, what would it be?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty simple and the interview was concerned with  gauging my interest in the position. I applied for a part time research position as a student.
Interview Questions: What are your interests ? Why do you believe you are a good fit for the position ?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application. Recruiter then contact me. Went on a interview with unit manager and department manager. 45 minutes of behavioral questions. HR contacted me 2 days later with an offer. All staff was super helpful and nice.
Interview Questions: describe a situation where you dealt with a difficult patient. what was the outcome.

title: Library Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The process took about a month and a half. Overall the staff was friendly but it was not as organized as I would have liked. For example, I was applying to two separate positions and when the recruiter for one of the positions called she scheduled a time for a phone interview. The other simply began asking me questions without giving me time to prepare and with no previous warning, so I was on speaker in a conference room with four separate employees and no preparation. Perhaps this was a simple screening, but I would have liked to been better informed.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you have an countered a tense situation with a coworker.

title: Business Objects Developer/Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the university career website. Very very slow interview process with five rounds of interview. I was approached by the hiring manager in March 2015 and had my initial screen. Initial screen lasted for about 25mins and later in April 2015 i had my second phone interview with the team. This was more of behavioral questions about my work and it lasted about 45mins. I had my third phone technical interview in the May 2015. This lasted for 30mins and purely technical. Then again in the last week of May 2015, i had a 30min skype interview call with the chief officers of the university which was again behavioral. In June 2015, finally i was called in for an in person interview which involved meeting the whole IT/non IT team and having lunch with them. The final round was more casual and it was good to meet everybody. This lasted for 3 to 4 hours.
Interview Questions:
1) How do you describe yourself
2) What do you expect from a manager
3) Describe a difficult situation with users that you had to handle
4) Define loop and different ways to resolve a loop
5) What is a derived table, aggregate table
6) few questions on BO administration

title: Temporary Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Emory University in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process took about 4 to 5 months. After you fill out the application and if you qualify they will contact you by email to take about 7 assessment test in a certain time frame. If you do well on the tests you are called in for a standard interview where they ask you questions like: tell me about yourself, why Emory, tell me a time where you dealt with a difficult situation and how did you handle it? What are your strengths/weaknesses.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths/weakness?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Submit resume and application online or at a career fair, one interview with the office manager. When I entered I was told she already intended to hire me, so it was nice to know where we stood going in.
Interview Questions: Are you keeping your hair like that?

title: Senior Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Most of hiring process through online--can be hard to navigate, but not impossible. I do not think my process was normal. The semester was about to begin and they needed to fill the position. I have found the administration here easy to work with and highly ethical. Emory is a good place to work.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with the lab manager. had a nice conversation. Hired after. Great fun easy process of getting hired. Conversation went well. Had a good time. Person that was hiring was very nice. No problems there. Wanted to ask many questions and did and they got answered. so no problem there. Hoped that i got the job and did so no problem there. hope that there was room for growth and development so no problem there.
Interview Questions: What are your goals professionally for this job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and emailed the HR department with my resume. I received a call within a week of sending my initial email. I interviewed with three different people on three different interviews.  After that they hired an internal person for the position.
Interview Questions: Give an example of your daily administrative task.

title: Non-clinical Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Campus recruiting. Two rounds in a row. Two interviews, each one is half an hour. One will ask you technical questions and the other ask you behavior question. One week later the HR will call you about the result and give you offer at that time. You only have two weeks or so to decide.
Interview Questions: If you had to be an animal, what animal would you be?

title: Dishwasher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was good overall  and it lasted for about 4 hours they had refreshments and drinks for us it was like 150 people in the building I had got there 25 mins held of time so I wouldn't be late
Interview Questions: Why do u think this company should hire u

title: Technical Project Manager-Yerkes National Primate Research Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Emory University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Over the course of 4 months I interviewed with everyone and their mama.  It seemed almost as if they were still trying to justify the position.  Just kept going and going, then after the last phone call, where he asked the question below, I never heard from anyone again.  Very RUDE, after I spent so much time going there to talk to everyone. one on one.  I deserved a call, email, etc. or something to say "thanks for your time, but no thanks" at the very least.
Interview Questions: After everything you've seen here and everyone you talked to, in what specific ways could you help us?

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, and get a email about person to person interview, after the interview, takes about 2 weeks, get an offer. The whole process is very fast and the interviewer is very helpful and nice. I enjoyed the whole process.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous experience? Strength and weakness

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was grueling but as to be expected given the nature of the job interviewing for. I was interviewed for almost an entire day.  I met with the research team as a whole first and then met with the "higher ups" individually.  It's an exhausting process but not intimidating at all.  Dress comfortable and eat well (fuel food) before and during process.
Interview Questions: What Skill set do you have that will be particularly helpful for this position?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Remember this was 12+ years ago so I'm sure some practices have changed.  I met with the CFO for a 1:1 interview, she felt I had too much experience for the front office. She interviewed me for a upcoming position.  I meet with 2 other supervisors that day which went well and received a call back by 4pm that day for a follow up interview.  I came in  24 hrs later and was offered the job by the HR Director. He was very funny and made me feel relaxed.
Interview Questions: How do I feel about animal research? And Animal Rights activist?

title: Public Health Program Associate Senior Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Initial communications and interview process very easy and seamless. Interviewers are laid back and helpful. Groups like to interview candidates so the team can understand if the candidate will be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Depending on what group you are interviewing with, questions such as sensitivity to other cultures, religions and backgrounds may come up. This is important when working with diverse groups and exciting to have opportunities to interact with people who come from all over the world with different experiences.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: preliminary phone interview, then all day interview. Gave me things to prepare and present for the all day interview. You will meet with a lot of different people. Make sure to send thank you notes or emails and to remember specific things from your conversations. They look for people who already understand and Emory university as a whole so a lot of research on the universities fundraising practices was necessary.
Interview Questions: How do you measure success?

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: They look for intelligence and problem solving. Basically, they want to see if you can multi-task and how you would react and handle various situations and patrons. There are a lot of things that can go wrong and a lot of people who can call you asking for all sorts of different things.
Interview Questions: How do you balance your time?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward and simple
Interview Questions: Most questions were simple and to the point

title: Associate Director, Student Conduct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I was initially hired as the first assistant director for the Office of Student Conduct, then promoted to associate director over four years later. My selection process was typical for a student affairs position: I submitted a cover letter, resume, and professional references. I had a telephone interview, then was invited for an on campus interview that was a full day in length and involved meetings with various constituency groups.
Interview Questions: At dinner the day before my interviewing began I was given a case study that was a composite of several difficult situations that office had recently addressed. I was asked to review the case and be prepared to discuss it at my final interview of the day.

title: Supplemental Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, professors want to know you have good grade in course, must be friendly and willing work hard and devote time. Most professors already have a student in mind they want to have to if you want to be considered really make an attempt to be very friendly and show you understand the material.
Interview Questions: Would you be available to hold sessions two times a week?

title: Campus Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: My interview was about 3 mins... they asked the question about my work ethics & I gave quick & direct anwsers... a week later I was hired!! It was self explanatory, on the spot questions,, but I didn't break a sweat..
Interview Questions: How would I react to a couple workers attitude

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of application - online application followed by Skype interview.  called for campus interview 3 weeks after Skype interview.  campus interview lasted 3 days.  interviews took place over breakfast, lunch and dinner, and a job talk presentation.
Interview Questions: A detailed question asked at the job talk

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: First round of the interview is a Powerpoint presentation of the previous work with a big group of researchers. The second round of the interview is to meet with lab members and to discuss their individual projects. Third round is to interview with the P.I to talk about the future work in the lab.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have

title: Medical Records Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the business manager, Erna, the first time.  She was very friendly and explained how Student Health had improved over the past few years.  We toured the facility, and I was introduced to the clinical providers and the front desk/business office team.  My second interview was a group interview, with Erna and the nursing supervisor and two of the MDs who work at Student Health.  It was my first group interview, and it went very well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?, which I suppose is a standard interview question.

title: Admission Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: When you are brought on-site, you are interviewed by a group of your potential future colleagues/peers. Usually it is several small groups but sometimes just one big group. You also give a presentation on a topic of your choice and then have a one-on-one with the supervisor
Interview Questions: Give an example of a group/organization/community where you have created a lasting impact that no one else could have done in quite the same way.

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straightforward and low-pressure. A student who would be in charge of the team conducted them individually. In hindsight, perhaps the actual adult employees of the University should have been present. It was mostly behavioral, and not much information about the position was given. She asked about my experience, which was quite little, and I was honest.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience working with cameras?

title: Sports Official Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview wasn't too bad. I met with the director of intramural sports in order to "get him to know me and get me to know him." Essentially, the interview process was very easy, nothing to get too worked up about. There was no technical questions besides a few basic questions about the basic rules of soccer and basketball. Additionally, he asked for a couple of stories that I've done that would demonstrate interest for this role.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a sports official for basketball and soccer?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Asked about previous experience, no specific questions in regards to skill. It was a one on one interview with a nice atmosphere. Look tidy and speak clearly. Looking for people who are good at customer service.
Interview Questions: Previous experience.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Checked out their website and read some of the articles. Emailed the prof and then went in to talk to prof, then get hired. The lab that hired me was Dr.Minsu Kim's lab which specialized in biophysics research. And a lot of the resource was invested in microbiology related topics.
Interview Questions: What is your research background

title: Clinical Research Coordinator III Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Worked here in the past. Was hired back. Interview process consisted of sending resume and one meeting with boss. Pretty simple. Most people are referral hires in the department. No aptitude/personality tests. There is a background/drug screen after you've been given an offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions:
Had a phone interview and was asked questions regarding to tasks of the job and my experience doing certain job requirements.

Very nice and said they would let me know as soon as they interviewed the other candidates.
Interview Questions: Questions were not that hard; just talking about my prior experience

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: First interview is over the phone.  Basically tests your ability to be conversational and think on your feet.  As well as gauging your interest in the job.
Interview Questions: How would you convince me if I were a potential donor, to give to Telefund or one of Emory's programs?>

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: email, then phone interview, then in-person interview with several people
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: The process was simple. There was only one interview and it was quite informal. The questions were not at all tricky. I applied online on the emory website and was contacted for an interview about a week later. I was actually offered the job based on my resume qualifications, so the interview was simply a chance for them to se if I was who I said i was.
Interview Questions: What unique characteristic will you add to the research team

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a group interview with everyone that I would be working with. The group interview was fine and very relaxed. I was asked a series of questions and then I had to present my past research.
Interview Questions: How do my experiences fit with their department?

title: Clinical Research Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: HR is generally slow is hiring for clinical research nurses due to their stringent screening process.  There are typically 3 to 4 interviews which they try to schedule in one or two days.
Interview Questions: How do you function in extremely stressful environments?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted and had a brief phone interview where we scheduled me to come in.  Standard interview questions, talking about what I had done, why I was looking right now, etc.  Had a second interview the next week and was extended an offer shortly afterwards.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: A/P Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University
Interview Descriptions: Easy
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: First there is a group interview where you are observed interacting with various other students on accomplishing a task. Then you are interviewed by two previous RAs. Finally, you have an individual interview with the Resident Life Coordinator.
Interview Questions: What are various programs you have planned for the students?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with Professor. Basic questions: Why do you like the subject? What do you want to get from this research position?
Interview Questions: None.

title: Grada Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a handful of faculty members in my prospective department. It was about 6 interviews, each approximately 20 minutes, back-to-back. They asked me questions about my previous research experience and what I wanted to do in the future.
Interview Questions: What would you like to do (research) while at Emory?

title: Research Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: It was very important to know someone inside Emory. It is a huge bureaucracy, and I feel sorry for those who do not have an insider to advance the process. Having such an insider, it was very easy for me. The red tape really occurred in salary negotiation; Emory wants to stay within specific boundaries, some of which are unrealistic.
Interview Questions: the toughest question is sometimes the most expected: Why would you want to be at Emory? Well, its a great university with wonderful benefits in a great city. Duh... But if you answer with that, it isn't original, so you're kinda stuck.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Facile process with a few question. It starts with a presentation and then meet all the group member. Everybody was nice and trying to help me. The offer came after several email correspondence which is kind of long process.I have no major complains.
Interview Questions: none

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I had two interviews.  The first was through a group setting and the second was with the PI over the phone.  They were somewhat relaxed and seemed like they were eager to hire someone asap.  The group interview consisted of me explaining what my last two work experiences were and any thing I wanted to add that was not on my resume like volunteer experiences.  There were not many behavioral questions other than,
"Where do you see yourself in 5 years? and What do you like to do for fun?"
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? (i.e. short term goals)

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews for this position.  The initial was with a hiring manager and the School's head of business and finance.  It seemed this was an initial screening interview.  The second interview was with the person I would report to directly.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral and functional questions.

title: Information Analyst III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: A brief phone interview was followed up by an interview at campus. Was asked a few coding questions and got to meet some of the team. Important to get along well with the team since you'll be interacting frequently with them. By and large, a stress free interview.
Interview Questions: A technical question on how an algorithm.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed 1 on 1,in office with administrator. Introduced to staff, sent for physical. Assigned a nurse educator who walked me through what I would be doing then without hoovering watched me do it.
Interview Questions: What do you think is your weakness?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Must apply via Emory University HR website.  Be prepared to enter details about educational background as well as contact information for all professional references up front.

Highly recommend connecting with someone in the department--HR often does not forward all resumes to the hiring manager!
Interview Questions: What would you tell a consulting MBA job seeker to do?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pre screening test, panel interview and two One on one interviews with Director and AVP drug screening background check skills reviewing lengthy process but worth the time parking difficult need to plan better for that.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions to see how you may fit within the organization

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Filled out application online.  Needed two recommendations, one from a Professor and the other from a supervisor from a job or extracurricular activity.  Was then contacted to come to an interview process that lasts about 2 hours in total.  We had a group interview, where the panel watched how we as candidates interacted with one another to discuss issues at Emory, then later a 2 on 1 interview with two ResLife staff members.
Interview Questions: If there is one area of Emory that you think needs more attention, what would it be and why?

title: Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: A quick chat and sent resume was all that it required. I began my time as a technology consultant for the goizueta business school computer lab as work study Ias a student) and when I didn't qualify, they still kept me on.  Great team and very easy to work with.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about the job?

title: Lead Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from HR requesting an interview. I met with the future boss and potential colleagues. They called me two weeks later to let me know their decision.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my past lab experience and how soon I would be available.

title: Web Or Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview and then on site interview with direct team I would be working with, marketing team, CIO and another manager. From my perspective the interview went well. They asked why did I want to work for Emory and to describe my work experience. They where late to the in person interview. Unfortunately the process took WAY too long 2 months. I had two interviews in the mean time from other companies with offers before I even got an update no longer under consideration. So regardless of an offer I would of had to turn it down.
Interview Questions: Describe the difference between html and xhtml

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very candid and friendly interview.  Very simple.  Sat me down in a professor's office and just asked me who I am and what I like doing on my off time.  It was quite casual and they just wanted to get a better idea of who I was.  It didn't seem too stuffy and or too uptight, as it was a very casual environment.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about research and testing on animals?

title: Administrative Assistant, Program Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: My experience was very different because I went through the in house temp service. Typically the interview process at Emory is long and drawn out, but I was called on a Thursday went in for the interview on a Monday and was offered the job that same day. I was at work a few days later.
Interview Questions: How are you with dificult personalities?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to tell them about myself. Then, they told me about the job and what criteria they were looking for in an applicant.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: quick, one on one interview with the PI. Followed presentation after 2 weeks and interviews with all the members of the lab and junior faculty. and a day after I got the job
Interview Questions: Why am I interested to join Emory?

title: Senior Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first then face-to-face interview with 3 staff members including 2 directors. Pretty standard interview in a professional and welcoming atmosphere. They explained the position in more detail then showed me an organizational chart and some reports the department produces. Took me on a tour of the office space and introduced me to the other staff.
Interview Questions:
What is your 5 year career plan?
What interests you about the position?
What is your relevant experience?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly quick process. Took 3 weeks met with everyone on the first visit, completed background and received offer. It was standard and easy. The communication was clear and directions were clear as well.
Interview Questions: There were alot of behavioral based questions.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: 3 day process. You will meet with 6-8 faculty, some of your choosing and some from the selection committee. Each interview is about 25 minutes. There is also a dinner with current students and a dinner with faculty. There is also a house party with students on the second night. 50 students are interviews for 14-18 slots.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to get a PhD?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: A full day of interviews with 4-5 faculty members.  Most asked about background in research and research interests. They wanted to make sure you were interested in research and knew what you were getting into. There was also a dinner with faculty members and other graduate students that was very relaxed.
Interview Questions: Q. What are your research interests?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: First and extensive telephone screen.  Note that this was after two levels of resume screening.  Then in-person with committee of at least three staff members.  Note that these included the direct supervisor, a co-worker and one additional team member.  The questions were scripted in advance and each interviewer had specific questions to ask.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you assisted a direct report or team member.

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Seminar, meetings with a dozen people
classical academic process.  Meet chairs, deans, faculty, try to impress all of them. 
Atypical job search for most professionals.  They try to assess your future potential as a scientist and if you place nicely with others.  Emory is an elite university and acts like it.  They have very high expectations.  Many faculty are anxious about the funding climate, but it is that way everywhere.
Interview Questions: Plans for future grants

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I am international so it was through skype. The professors are very nice and I feel if they give you an interview, they probably feel you are qualified. So the interview was not technical, but more conversational and they tab more into motivation.
Interview Questions: You were studying pharmaceutical science, why switch to chemistry as in basic science?

title: Research Informatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Hiring takes forever, even after a verbal offer.  Utilizes the "targeted selection" process by DDS (read about it before interviewing and save everyone a lot of time).  Panel interviews (around three people) and a solo interview.  There will be a drug test and you will need to be up to date on your vaccinations.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you failed miserably at something and what you did to remedy the failure (or something to that effect).  Targeted Selection is a behavioral interview style and if you're already at this stage, you've met the technical aptitude requirements.  Now they need to feel out your personality.

title: Payroll Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Took a total of one month from appication to completing new hire docs
Interview Questions: Tested on computer abilities and knowledge

title: Research Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Emailed a professor whose research I was interested in.  Took a lot of emails to get a response, interview was straightforward.  Since I was interested in the research and qualified I received the job
Interview Questions: Whether I have clinical trials experience, and whether or not I have the ability to simultaneously do data analysis, management, and coordinate a trial.

title: Research Specialist Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Emory University (Decatur, GA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: very slow and process is hard to folllow
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Emory University in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Four or five faculty members talk for about 30min, mostly on their own research projects. They may ask you for your opinion on some specific questions as a way to test your thinking capability. Would be a huge bonus if you can ace it but would not be a big concern if you feel you did a mediocre job.
Interview Questions: Please try to design a high-throughput screening method for antiviral drug discovery which also takes into account of cell viability.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Emory University in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was lengthy.  It usually takes 6 months from the time the search opens.  Communications were great once selected to interview. 
Interviews were scheduled throughout the day. 
1st was with HR, then the Director, then the team, then constitutants which was with a panel of 6 -7 people.  They try to be very formal but are really looking for the "real" you.
Interview Questions: Tell us why we should not hire you

title: Associate Director, MBA Student Career Advising Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: The selection process began with a phone interview. The phone interview include general questions regarding my interest in the position, my transferable skills, and my interest in the company.  After passing the phone interview, I was asked to come in for three rounds of interviews and a presentation.
Interview Questions: What would be the first thing you would do if selected for this position?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions:
I applied directly to the PI. Initial communication was through email, followed that by a phone interview.  The phone interview was confined to science; mostly my research, what interests me about the lab, etc. I was then invited to visit the lab, interact with other members of the lab, meet faculty members with whom we collaborate and then a presentation. 

I was offered the job within 48 hours. 

The whole process from the initial contact to the offer stage took only 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Mostly conversational. General stuff about research and science.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions:
1:1 interview took place at a restaurant during a professional meeting. 
My future boss and I discuss what the position would entail and which skills I would bring to the lab.
Interview Questions: What is the best contribution you could bring to the lab?

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: Applied for position via company website.  Received email from HR indicating that I qualified for position and that application had been forwarded to hiring department.  Received call for interview.  Interviewed for position.  Received notice of candidate selection.
Interview Questions: What sort of fund raising have you done?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview procedure is standard, just ask some technique in my resume and ask me some plan. Then I was taken to the lab and look around. The whole process just take 1 hour. I think the lab professor then made decision.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Emory University (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was quick and efficient - I believe they really were in need of an assistant. High turnover in my position in the last couple of years. I had about 2 face to face interviews, first one was basic and very general and the second interview were more questionnaires and scenarios and I had to provide examples. Both times interview took place with the same person.
Interview Questions: How id you handle a certain situation?
